definition: see 居禮夫人|居礼夫人[Ju1 li3 Fu1 ren5]
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
Li (surname)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: Madame Curie warned learners not to go too fast.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人告誡初學者不要圖快。

sentences.english: Madame Curie devoted all her time to the study of radium.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人一生致力於鐳的研究。

sentences.english: Madame Curie was one of the Greatest scientists in the world.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人是世界裏最偉大的科學家之一。

sentences.english: Madame Curie didn't suffer as they did.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人沒有向他們那樣受苦。

sentences.english: Madame Curie discovered the element radium.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人發現了鐳元素。

sentences.english: A few years later Marie Curie took a lover.
sentences.chinese: 一些年後，居里夫人有了一個情人。

sentences.english: It was Madame Curie who discovered the element radium.
sentences.chinese: 是居里夫人發現了鐳元素。

sentences.english: Madame Curie took the doctor's degree in physics in 1903.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人於1903年取的物理學博士學位。

sentences.english: Madame Curie will long be remembered as the discoverer of radium.
sentences.chinese: 人們將永遠記住居里夫人是鐳的發現者。

sentences.english: Madame Curie discovered pure radium in 1902.
Madame Curie was a woman we admired .
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人是我們崇拜的女性。

definition: Albert Einstein (1879-1955), German-born theoretical physicist
Qian Sanqiang
physicist
Hua Luogeng (1910-1985), Chinese number theorist
Tsung-Dao Lee (1926-), Chinese American physicist, Columbia University, 1957 Nobel laureate
Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen (1845-1923), German mechanical engineer
Chen Jingrun (1933-1996) Chinese number theorist
Rutherford (name)/Ernest Rutherford (1871-1937), early nuclear physicist from New Zealand
Zhao Zhongyao (1902-1998), Chinese pioneer nuclear physicist
Dmitri Ivanovich Mendeleev (1834-1907), Russian chemist who introduced the periodic table
Qian Xuesen (1911-2009), Chinese scientist and aeronautical engineer
Edison (name)/Thomas Alva Edison (1847-1931), American inventor and businessman
Guo Yonghuai (1909-1968), Chinese aviation pioneer
Antoine Lavoisier (1743-1794), French nobleman and scientist, considered the father of modern chemistry
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Samuel C. C. Ting (1936-), American physicist, 1976 Nobel Prize laureate in physics
